column1: '''I See Fire''' is a song, written and performed by [[Ed Sheeran]], that features in the end credits of ''[[The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug]]''. It is also the fourteenth track of the second disc of both ''[[The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug - Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]]'' and [[The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug - Original Motion Picture Soundtrack - Special Edition

column2: <poem>Oh, misty eye of the mountain below

column1: Keep careful watch of my brothers' souls
And should the sky be filled with fire and smoke
If this is to end in fire
Then we should all burn together
Watch the flames climb high into the night
Calling out father, oh, stand by and we will
Watch the flames burn auburn on
And if we should die tonight
Then we should all die together
Raise a glass of wine for the last time
Watch the flames burn auburn over
And I hope that you remember me
Oh, should my people fall in
We got too close to the flame
Watch the flames burn auburn on
And I hope that you remember me
And if the night is burning
For if the dark returns then
And as the sky is falling down
It crashed into this lonely town
And with that shadow upon the ground
I hear my people screaming out
I see fire (Oh you know I saw a city burning) (fire)
And I see fire (Feel the heat upon my skin, yeah) (fire)
And I see fire burn auburn on the mountain side </poem>}}
